00027 #ifndef _TESSEROIDS_UTILS_H_
00028 #define _TESSEROIDS_UTILS_H_

00031 /* Need for the definition of FILE */
00032 #include <stdio.h>
00033 
00034 
00036 typedef struct tess_struct {
00037     /* s, n, w, e in degrees. r1 and r2 are the smaller and larger radius */
00038     double density; 
00039     double w; 
00040     double e; 
00041     double s; 
00042     double n; 
00043     double r1; 
00044     double r2; 
00045 } TESSEROID;
00046 
00047 
00049 typedef struct prism_struct {
00050     double density; 
00051     double x1; 
00052     double x2; 
00053     double y1; 
00054     double y2; 
00055     double z1; 
00056     double z2; 
00057     /* Geodetic coordinates of the center of the top face of the prism */
00058     /* double lonc, latc, rc;*/
00059 } PRISM;
00060 
00061 
00063 typedef struct sphere_struct {
00064     double density; 
00065     double r; 
00066     double lonc; 
00067     double latc; 
00068     double rc; 
00069 } SPHERE;
00070 
00071 
00072 /* Change the coordinates of a point P from a global coordinate system to the
00073     local system of a point Q
00074 
00075 Coordinates given in SI and degrees!
00076 
00077 Uses constant MEAN_EARTH_RADIUS.
00078 
00079 \image latex coordinate_sys.pdf "Points P and Q in the global coordinate system and their local systems"
00080 \image html coordinate_sys.png "Points P and Q in the global coordinate system and their local systems"
00081 
00082 @param lonp longitude of point P
00083 @param latp latitude of point P
00084 @param rp radial coordinate of point P
00085 @param lonq longitude of point Q (origin of the local system)
00086 @param latq latitude of point Q (origin of the local system)
00087 @param rq radial coordinate of point Q (origin of the local system)
00088 @param xp x coordinate of P in the local system of Q
00089 @param yp y coordinate of P in the local system of Q
00090 @param zp z coordinate of P in the local system of Q
00091 */
00092 /*extern void chcoord_g2l(double lonp, double latp, double rp, double lonq,
00093                     double latq, double rq, double *xp, double *yp, double *zp);
00094 */
